oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THE KINEMATICS OF WAVE INDUCED FLOWS AROUND NEAR-BED PIPELINES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bruce, T.
Easson, W.J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: pipeling
wave induced flow
wave kinematics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Particle Image Velocimetry (PIV) has been applied successfully to give quantitative, full field measurements of instantaneous velocity fields for oscillatory flows past a model of a pipeline above a plane bed. The application of PIV to this problem is discussed, and results for the case of KC = 20 with gap ratios 1.0 and 0.1 are presented in the form of velocity vector maps, and contour plots of vorticity distribution.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 23 (1992): Proceedings of 23rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Venice, Italy, 1992.
